db:info.db:titleabbrev: Qt Lightweight HTTP Server Reference Documentation

db:abstract.db:para: Simple example of how to set up an HTTP server.

db:article.db:para: This example shows how to set up a server using the QHttpServer class. The server is bound to an incoming port using the listen() function, and the route() function is used to add a handler for each of several different incoming URLs. For one of the URLs, "/auth", Basic HTTP Authentication is used.
In the above example QSslConfiguration is used to show how to create an SSL configuration for a QHttpServer to serve HTTPS traffic.
